text:
78F h/o severe COPD [ numerous admissions for dyspnea], bronchiectasis,
   tracheobronchomalacia with Y-stent placed by IP [ [**10-30**]] was found in
    respiratory distress at pulmonary rehab and  sent to [**First Name4 (NamePattern1) **] [**Last Name (NamePattern1) 73**] -
   7.22/110/176, CXR shows RLLL  - trial BiPap but subsequently intubated
   and transferred to [**Hospital1 19**] for further evaluation & management of airway
   issues/sepsis.   No known complaints prior to decompensation but pt
   unable to provide history.  Hypotensive SBP 80s lactate in ED @ 4.1
   IVF bolus [ total 3l given]  and pan cx
 of note, hypertensive at
   baseline- also received vanc, levo, zosyn, transferred to MICU.
   EVENTS. received further 2l n/saline [ post lactate now @ < 2.0], await
   blood dx data
                    Received 4grms mag for level @ 1.1 [ all am labs due
   at 06.30hrs and repeat CXR due @ 0800hrs]
                    A line placed and maps maintained > 65
                    Received meropenum for AB coverage [ received vanc in
   ED]
                    3 daughters and x1 son visited
   Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD, Bronchitis, Emphysema)
   with Acute Exacerbation
   Assessment:
   Patient known COPD, with Y stents in place [ IP informed of admission].
   CXR on admission shows RLL pneumonia.. received Intubated AC 20x 400
   100% peep @ 5, lightly sedated on versed at 2, able to follow simple
   commands, SX for large amount of thick creamy secretions upon
   admission, lungs sound course throughout
   Action:
   Abgs improved and fio2 weaned to 40%, no change with sedation, ABS as
   ordered, SX prn
   Response:
   Improving abgs overnight
   Plan:
   For repeat abg at 06.30hrs, wean vent as tolerated, for IP review this
   am
   Sepsis without organ dysfunction
   Assessment:
   Received with borderline b/p 90 systolic maps @ 60, minimal U/O in ED ,
   HR 100-110, lactate in ED @ 4.1, had received total 3l fluid there plus
   ABS as above, CVP @ [**7-31**], afebrile
   Action:
   Received further 2l fluid, meropenum commenced, a line placed
   Response:
   Stable B/P with systolics >100 maps >70, u/o > 30, lactate this am 1.1
   Plan:
   Continue to maintain maps > 65 , observe U/O ? will require further
   fluid resuscitation, trend lactate, fever curve, ABS as ordered

info.concept: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease of horses
Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease of horses
